org.hps.analysis.trigger

Class TriggerDiagnostic2019Driver

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.lcsim.util.Driver
      • org.hps.analysis.trigger.TriggerDiagnostic2019Driver

  • public class TriggerDiagnostic2019Driver
extends Driver
    Driver TriggeDiagnostic2019Driver performs a comparison between the trigger results reported by the hardware and those simulated by the LCSim software for a single trigger.

    The driver requires simulated trigger objects, which are produced separately by the driver DataTriggerSim2019Driver, in order to function. It also requires the presence of the runtime settings management driver, DAQConfiguration2019Driver.

    The driver works by taking trigger objects simulated by LCSim, using both hardware reported (VTP) clusters and software clusters, and comparing these to the hardware's reported triggers. Reported triggers include a trigger time and which cuts passed. The driver requires that there exists a hardware trigger that matches in each of these fields for every simulated trigger. Note that the reverse may not be true; pulse-clipping can occur for simulated clusters, resulting in a reduced cluster energy, that can affect whether a cluster or pair passes the trigger. This does not occur at the hardware level, though. As such, triggers within the "pulse-clipping" region are not necessarily comparable. The driver ignores these.

    Output consists primarily of text printed at the end of the run. The driver outputs the overall efficiency (defined as the number of simulated triggers matched versus the total number) for both cluster types. It also provides a more detailed table that further separates this into efficiency by cluster type and active TS bit. The other output is an efficiency over time plot that shows the efficiency for a programmable time frame throughout the run. Driver TriggeDiagnostic2019Driver is developed based on Driver TriggeDiagnosticDriver

        private boolean[] tsFlags
        Indicates which TS-bits are active in the current event. Array indices should align with TriggerType.ordinal(). Values set by the method setTSFlags(TSData2019) and is called by the process(EventHeader) method.

        private boolean isActiveBitRead
        Indicates if TS-bits are read. For random runs, there are no TS-bits.

        Stores the singles trigger settings. Array is of size 4, with each array index corresponding to the trigger of the same trigger number.

        Stores the pair trigger settings. Array is of size 4, with each array index corresponding to the trigger of the same trigger number.

        private String moduleHeader
        Defines the basic directory structure for all plots used in the class. This is instantiated in startOfData.

      • bins

        private int[] bins
        Stores the number of bins used by the efficiency plots for each conventional trigger cut. Array index corresponds to the ordinal value of the CutType enumerable for all values for which isSpecial() is false. Note that this variable is defined as a function of the variable arrays xMax, xMin and binSize during startOfData().

      • ALL_TRIGGERS

        private static final int ALL_TRIGGERS

      • LOCAL_WINDOW_TRIGGERS

        private static final int LOCAL_WINDOW_TRIGGERS

      • simTriggerCount

        private int[][] simTriggerCount
        Stores the total number of simulated triggers observed for each source type. The first array index defines the source type and corresponds to the variables SOURCE_SIM_CLUSTER and SOURCE_VTP_CLUSTER. The second array index defines one of several conditions. This includes triggers seen when a certain TS bit was active, with these indices defined by TriggerType.ordinal(), all triggers seen in general, defined by ALL_TRIGGERS, and all triggers seen in the local window, defined by LOCAL_WINDOW_TRIGGERS.

      • hardwareTriggerCount

        private int[] hardwareTriggerCount
        Stores the total number of hardware triggers observed for each source type. The first array index defines the source type and corresponds to the variables SOURCE_SIM_CLUSTER and SOURCE_VTP_CLUSTER. The second array index defines one of several conditions. This includes triggers seen when a certain TS bit was active, with these indices defined by TriggerType.ordinal(), all triggers seen in general, defined by ALL_TRIGGERS, and all triggers seen in the local window, defined by LOCAL_WINDOW_TRIGGERS.

      • matchedTriggerCount

        private int[][] matchedTriggerCount
        Stores the total number of matched triggers observed for each source type. The first array index defines the source type and corresponds to the variables SOURCE_SIM_CLUSTER and SOURCE_VTP_CLUSTER. The second array index defines one of several conditions. This includes triggers seen when a certain TS bit was active, with these indices defined by TriggerType.ordinal(), all triggers seen in general, defined by ALL_TRIGGERS, and all triggers seen in the local window, defined by LOCAL_WINDOW_TRIGGERS.

        private static final int LOCAL_MATCHED_TRIGGERS
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • efficiencyPlotEntries

        private List<Pair<Long,int[][]>> efficiencyPlotEntries
        Stores entries for the efficiency over time plot. The first entry in the pair represents the time of the local sample. This is defined with respect to the start of the first observed event. The second entry contains the observed and matched triggers for both trigger source types. The first array index defines the source type and corresponds to the index variables defined in SOURCE_SIM_CLUSTER and SOURCE_VTP_CLUSTER. The second array index defines to observed and matched triggers, and corresponds to the indices defined by the variables LOCAL_ALL_TRIGGERS and LOCAL_MATCHED_TRIGGERS.

        public void endOfData()

        Overrides:

      • process

        public void process(EventHeader event)
        Processes an event and performs trigger verification. Method will only run if the ConfigurationManager2019 has been initialized. Handles testing for noise events and extracting basic event data for analysis, and also ensuring that everything necessary is present. Event trigger data is actually processed separately by the method triggerVerification. Method also handles logger output.
        Overrides:
        process in class Driver
        Parameters:
        event - - The data object containing all event data.

      • compareSimulatedToHardwareSingles

        private int compareSimulatedToHardwareSingles(Collection<Trigger<?>> simTriggers,
                                              Collection<VTPSinglesTrigger> hardwareTriggers,
                                              Class<?> clusterType)
        Compares a collection of simulated triggers to a collection of triggers reported by the hardware. The simulated triggers may be simulated from either VTP clusters or clusters built by the software.
        Parameters:
        simTriggers - - A collection containing Trigger objects. The source objects for the Trigger objects may be either Cluster or VTPCluster, as well as a size two array of either of the above.
        hardwareTriggers - - A collection of VTP hardware triggers. The source objects of type is VTPSinglesTrigger.
        clusterType - - Specifies which of the four valid object types is used as the source of the Trigger objects defined in the simTriggers argument.
        Returns:
        Returns the number of simulated triggers which were successfully matched to hardware triggers.

      • compareSimulatedToHardwarePairs

        private int compareSimulatedToHardwarePairs(Collection<Trigger<?>> simTriggers,
                                            Collection<VTPPairsTrigger> hardwareTriggers,
                                            Class<?> clusterType)
        Compares a collection of simulated triggers to a collection of triggers reported by the hardware. The simulated triggers may be simulated from either VTP clusters or clusters built by the software.
        Parameters:
        simTriggers - - A collection containing Trigger objects. The source objects for the Trigger objects may be either Cluster or VTPCluster, as well as a size two array of either of the above.
        hardwareTriggers - - A collection of VTP hardware triggers. The source objects of type is VTPPairsTrigger.
        clusterType - - Specifies which of the four valid object types is used as the source of the Trigger objects defined in the simTriggers argument.
        Returns:
        Returns the number of simulated triggers which were successfully matched to hardware triggers.

                                                             String hitCollectionName)
        Gets the a of CalorimeterHit objects from the argument event from the LCIO collection hitCollectionName.
        Parameters:

        hitCollectionName - - The name of the hit collection.
        Returns:

      • getPairTriggerTime

        private static final double getPairTriggerTime(Trigger<?> trigger)
                                        throws IllegalArgumentException
        A helper method associated with getTriggerTime that handles pair triggers, which have either Cluster[] or VTPCluster[] objects as their source type. This method should not be called directly.
        Parameters:
        trigger - - The trigger object for which to obtain the trigger time.
        Returns:
        Returns the trigger time as a double.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Occurs if the trigger source object type is anything other than Cluster[] or VTPCluster[].

      • getSinglesTriggerTime

        private static final double getSinglesTriggerTime(Trigger<?> trigger)
                                           throws IllegalArgumentException
        A helper method associated with getTriggerTime that handles singles triggers, which have either Cluster or VTPCluster objects as their source type. This method should not be called directly.
        Parameters:
        trigger - - The trigger object for which to obtain the trigger time.
        Returns:
        Returns the trigger time as a double.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Occurs if the trigger source object type is anything other than Cluster or VTPCluster.

      • getTriggerSourceText

        private static final String[] getTriggerSourceText(Trigger<?> trigger)
                                            throws IllegalArgumentException
        Gets a textual representation of the trigger source cluster(s).
        Parameters:
        trigger - - The trigger for which to obtain the textual representation.
        Returns:
        Returns a String array containing a textual representation of the trigger's source cluster(s). Each entry in the array represents an individual cluster.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Occurs if the trigger source object type is anything other than Cluster, VTPCluster, or an array of either of these two object types.

      • getTriggerText

        private final String getTriggerText(Trigger<?> trigger,
                                    boolean includeSource)
                             throws IllegalArgumentException
        Gets a textual representation of the trigger.
        Parameters:
        trigger - - The trigger for which to obtain the textual representation.
        includeSource - - Indicates whether a textual representation of the source objects for the trigger should be included. These will be present on a new line, one for each cluster.
        Returns:
        Returns a String object representing the trigger. If includeSource is set to true, this will be more than one line.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Occurs if the trigger source object type is anything other than Cluster, VTPCluster, or an array of either of these two object types.

      • getTriggerText

        private final String getTriggerText(VTPSinglesTrigger trigger)
        Gets a textual representation of the trigger.
        Parameters:
        trigger - - The trigger for which to obtain the textual representation.
        Returns:
        Returns a String object representing the trigger.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Occurs if the trigger subclass is not either an VTPSinglesTrigger object or an VTPPairTrigger object.

      • getTriggerText

        private final String getTriggerText(VTPPairsTrigger trigger)

      • getTriggerTime

        private static final double getTriggerTime(Trigger<?> trigger)
                                    throws IllegalArgumentException
        Gets the trigger time for an arbitrary trigger object as is appropriate to its source object type.
        Parameters:
        trigger - - The trigger object for which to obtain the trigger time.
        Returns:
        Returns the trigger time as a double.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Occurs if the trigger source object type is anything other than Cluster, VTPCluster, or a size-two array of either of the previous two object types.

      • isPairTrigger

        private static final boolean isPairTrigger(Trigger<?> trigger)
        Indicates whether a generic trigger object is a pair trigger.
        Parameters:
        trigger - - The trigger to check.
        Returns:
        Returns true in the case that the source object is a Cluster[], or VTPCluster[]. Otherwise, returns false.

      • isSinglesTrigger

        private static final boolean isSinglesTrigger(Trigger<?> trigger)
        Indicates whether a generic trigger object is a singles trigger.
        Parameters:
        trigger - - The trigger to check.
        Returns:
        Returns true in the case that the source object is a Cluster or VTPCluster. Otherwise, returns false.

                      throws IllegalArgumentException

        Parameters:
        values - - The values from which to find the maximum.
        Returns:
        Returns whichever value is the highest from within the set.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Occurs if no arguments are given.

      • setTSFlags

        private boolean setTSFlags(TSData2019 tsData)
        Sets the TS-bit flags for each trigger type and also indicates whether or not at least one TI-bit was found active.
        Parameters:
        tsBank - - The TS bank from which to set the flags.
        Returns:
        Returns true if at least one TI-bit was found active, and false if no bits were active.

      • setNoiseThresholdEcal

        public void setNoiseThresholdEcal(int threshold)
        Sets the total number of hits for Ecal that must be present in an event in order for it to be considered a noise event. This is only applied if skipNoiseEventsEcal is set to true.
        Parameters:
        threshold - - The noise hit threshold for Ecal.

      • setNoiseThresholdHodo

        public void setNoiseThresholdHodo(int threshold)
        Sets the total number of hits for hodoscope that must be present in an event in order for it to be considered a noise event. This is only applied if skipNoiseEventsHodo is set to true.
        Parameters:
        threshold - - The noise hit threshold for hodoscope.

      • setSkipNoiseEventsEcal

        public void setSkipNoiseEventsEcal(boolean state)
        Indicates whether events which exceed a certain number of total hits for Ecal, defined by noiseEventThresholdEcal, should be treated as noise events and skipped.
        Parameters:
        state - - true causes noise events to be skipped and false does not.

      • setSkipNoiseEventsHodo

        public void setSkipNoiseEventsHodo(boolean state)
        Indicates whether events which exceed a certain number of total hits for hodoscope, defined by noiseEventThresholdHodo, should be treated as noise events and skipped.
        Parameters:
        state - - true causes noise events to be skipped and false does not.

      • setPrintOnHardwareSimFailure

        public void setPrintOnHardwareSimFailure(boolean state)
        Indicates whether the event log should be printed when a trigger which was simulated from a hardware-reported (VTP) cluster fails to verify.
        Parameters:
        state - - true indicates that the event log should be printed, and false that it should not.

      • setPrintOnSoftwareSimFailure

        public void setPrintOnSoftwareSimFailure(boolean state)
        Indicates whether the event log should be printed when a trigger which was simulated from a software-constructed cluster fails to verify.
        Parameters:
        state - - true indicates that the event log should be printed, and false that it should not.

      • setTriggerCollectionName

        public void setTriggerCollectionName(String collection)
        Sets the name of LCIO collection containing simulated triggers.
        Parameters:
        collection - - The collection name.

      • setTriggerType

        public void setTriggerType(String type)
                    throws IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the which of the triggers this driver should verify. This value must be of the following:
        • SINGLESTOP0
        • SINGLESTOP1
        • SINGLESTOP2
        • SINGLESTOP3
        • SINGLESBOT0
        • SINGLESBOT1
        • SINGLESBOT2
        • SINGLESBOT3
        • PAIR0
        • PAIR1
        • PAIR2
        • PAIR3
        Parameters:
        type - - The String indicating which trigger should be verified.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Occurs if any type name is besides those specified above is used.

      • setTriggerWindowEnd

        public void setTriggerWindowEnd(int value)
        Sets the end of the trigger window range. This is used during hardware-cluster simulated trigger verification.
        Parameters:
        value - - The end of the trigger window range. This value is inclusive.

      • setTriggerWindowStart

        public void setTriggerWindowStart(int value)
        Sets the start of the trigger window range. This is used during hardware-cluster simulated trigger verification.
        Parameters:
        value - - The start of the trigger window range. This value is inclusive.
